intro: Maerua rosmarinoides, commonly known as the African tea plant, is a shrub native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Capparaceae and is characterized by its aromatic, needle-like leaves that resemble those of rosemary. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that are followed by distinctive, round, fleshy fruits. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, making it well adapted to drought conditions. The leaves are often used in traditional medicine and as a spice due to their aromatic properties.
